natural problem: The area of the parallelogram generated by the vectors $\mathbf{a}$ and $\mathbf{b}$ is 8.  Find the area of the parallelogram generated by the vectors $2 \mathbf{a} + 3 \mathbf{b}$ and $\mathbf{a} - 5 \mathbf{b}.$
natural solution: Since the area of the parallelogram generated by the vectors $\mathbf{a}$ and $\mathbf{b}$ is 8, \[\|\mathbf{a} \times \mathbf{b}\| = 8.\]Then the area of the parallelogram generated by the vectors $2 \mathbf{a} + 3 \mathbf{b}$ and $\mathbf{a} - 5 \mathbf{b}$ is

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes a b :: "'a::real_vector"
assumes h0 : "norm(cross_product a b) = 8"
shows  "norm(cross_product (2 *\<^sub>R a + 3 *\<^sub>R b) (a - 5 *\<^sub>R b)) = 104"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 The area of the parallelogram generated by the vectors $\mathbf{a}$ and $\mathbf{b}$ is 8.  Find the area of the parallelogram generated by the vectors $2 \mathbf{a} + 3 \mathbf{b}$ and $\mathbf{a} - 5 \mathbf{b}.$ The final Answer is 104
 ### Proof
 Since the area of the parallelogram generated by the vectors $\mathbf{a}$ and $\mathbf{b}$ is 8, \[\|\mathbf{a} \times \mathbf{b}\| = 8.\]Then the area of the parallelogram generated by the vectors $2 \mathbf{a} + 3 \mathbf{b}$ and $\mathbf{a} - 5 \mathbf{b}$ is
 \[\|(2 \mathbf{a} + 3 \mathbf{b}) \times (\mathbf{a} - 5 \mathbf{b})\|.\]Expanding the cross product, we get \begin{align} (2 \mathbf{a} + 3 \mathbf{b}) \times (\mathbf{a} - 5 \mathbf{b}) &= 2 \mathbf{a} \times \mathbf{a} - 10 \mathbf{a} \times \mathbf{b} + 3 \mathbf{b} \times \mathbf{a} - 15 \mathbf{b} \times \mathbf{b} \\
 &= \mathbf{0} - 10 \mathbf{a} \times \mathbf{b} - 3 \mathbf{a} \times \mathbf{b} - \mathbf{0} \\ &= -13 \mathbf{a} \times \mathbf{b}. \end{align}Thus, $\|(2 \mathbf{a} + 3 \mathbf{b}) \times (\mathbf{a} - 5 \mathbf{b})\| = 13 \|\mathbf{a} \times \mathbf{b}\| = \boxed{104}.$
 *)

theorem
fixes a b :: "'a::real_vector"
assumes h0 : "norm(cross_product a b) = 8"
shows  "norm(cross_product (2 *\<^sub>R a + 3 *\<^sub>R b) (a - 5 *\<^sub>R b)) = 104"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: Given two vectors a and b in a real vector space where the magnitude (or norm) of their cross product is 8, find the magnitude of the cross product of the vectors (2a + 3b) and (a - 5b). The final answer is 104.

 *)

a_7.formal problem:
theorem
fixes a b :: "'a::real_normed_vector"
assumes h0 : "norm (cross_product a b) = 8"
shows  "norm (cross_product (2 *\<^sub>R a + 3 *\<^sub>R b) (a - 5 *\<^sub>R b)) = 104"
a_7.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 The area of the parallelogram generated by the vectors $\mathbf{a}$ and $\mathbf{b}$ is 8.  Find the area of the parallelogram generated by the vectors $2 \mathbf{a} + 3 \mathbf{b}$ and $\mathbf{a} - 5 \mathbf{b}.$ The final Answer is 104

 \[\|(2 \mathbf{a} + 3 \mathbf{b}) \times (\mathbf{a} - 5 \mathbf{b})\|.\]Expanding the cross product, we get \begin{align} (2 \mathbf{a} + 3 \mathbf{b}) \times (\mathbf{a} - 5 \mathbf{b}) &= 2 \mathbf{a} \times \mathbf{a} - 10 \mathbf{a} \times \mathbf{b} + 3 \mathbf{b} \times \mathbf{a} - 15 \mathbf{b} \times \mathbf{b} \\
 &= \mathbf{0} - 10 \mathbf{a} \times \mathbf{b} - 3 \mathbf{a} \times \mathbf{b} - \mathbf{0} \\ &= -13 \mathbf{a} \times \mathbf{b}. \end{align}Thus, $\|(2 \mathbf{a} + 3 \mathbf{b}) \times (\mathbf{a} - 5 \mathbf{b})\| = 13 \|\mathbf{a} \times \mathbf{b}\| = \boxed{104}.$
 *)
